lines.gurmukhi: 1 vsqU inrdyS mMglwcrx
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realised through the grace of the divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: AwpnVY hiQ AwrsI Awpy hI dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapanarhai Hadi Aarasee Aapay Hee Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mirror (in the form of world) is in the hand (of the Lord) and man sees of himself in it.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy dyiK idKwiedw iCA drsin ByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Daykhi Dikhaaidaa Chhia Darasani Bhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: God visualises and makes men see the guises and  philosophies of six Schools (in this mirror).

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw mUMh kir Bwildw qyvyhY lyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Moohu Kari Bhaalidaa Tayvayhai Laykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Man is reflected (in the mirror) in exactly the same way as is his propensity.

lines.gurmukhi: hsdy hsdw dyKIAY so rUp sryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Hasaday Hasadaa Daykheeai So Roop Saraykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The laughing person finds a  laughing form in it.

lines.gurmukhi: rody idsY rovdw hoie inmK inmyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Rodai Disai Rovadaa Hoay Nimakh Nimaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whereas the wailing person finds himself (as well as everybody) there in the weeping posture. Same is the case of a clever person.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw siqsMig ivsyKY ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Satisangi Visaykhai ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord Himself is prevading this world-mirror but He is specifically preceivable in and through the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 vwihgurU mMqR

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of an instrumentalist

lines.gurmukhi: ijau jMqRI hiQ jMqR lY siB rwg vjwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jantree Hadi Jantr Lai Sabhi Raag Vajaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord resembles to an instrumentalist who holding the instrument in his hand plays all the different measures on it.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy suix suix mgnu hoie Awpy gux gwey
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Souni Souni Maganu Hoi Aapay Goun Gaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to the tunes played he remain immersed in them and eulogises the Supreme.

lines.gurmukhi: sbdu suriq ilvlIxu hoie Awip rIiJ rIJwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Liv Leenu Hoi Aapi Reejhi Reejhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Merging his consciousness in the Word he becomes elated and makes others also delighted.

lines.gurmukhi: kQqw bkqw Awip hY surqw ilv lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Kadataa Bakataa Aapi Hai Surataa Liv Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lord is the speaker as well as the listener immersed in super consciousness.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip ivsmwdu hoie srbMig smwey
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Hee Visamaadu Hoi Sarabangi Samaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Himself all bliss He premeates one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK pqIAwey ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Pateeaaay ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: This mystery that the Lord is omnipresent, is only understood by a gurmukh, the Guru oriented one.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 Awpy rsIAw Awp rs

Shabad OS B.translation: Himself the enjoyer as well as the joy

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy BuKw hoiekY Awip jwie rsoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Bhoukhaa Hoi Kai Aapi Jaai Rasoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He (the Lord) Himself posing to be hungry goes into the kitchen and cooks the food kneading in it all sorts of delights.

lines.gurmukhi: Bojn Awip bxwiedw rs ivic rs goeI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhojanu Aapi Banaaidaa Ras Vichi Ras Goee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Himself eating and getting  satiated He showers praises on the dainty dishes.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Kwie slwihkY hoie qiRpiq smoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Khaai Salaahi Kai Hoi Tripati Samoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He Himself is the delight as well as the delighted.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy rsIAw Awip rs rsu rsnw BoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Raseeaa Aapi Rasu Rasu Rasanaa Bhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is the juice as well as the tongue which relishes its taste.

lines.gurmukhi: dwqw Bugqw Awip hY srbMg smoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Daataa Bhougataa Aapi Hai Sarabangu Samoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He permeating through all, Himself is the giver as well as receiver.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK suKu hoeI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Soukhu Hoee ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Knowing the fact that He permeates among all, the Gurmukh feels immense pleasure.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Himself the enjoyer as well as the joy

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy plMGu ivCwiekY Awip AMdir sauNdw
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Palaghu Vichhaai Kai Aapi Andari Saoundaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He Himself spreads the bedstead and Himself reclines on it.

lines.gurmukhi: suhxy AMdir jwie kY dysMqr BauNdw
lines.transliteration_english: Suhanay Andari Jaai Kai Daysantari Bhaoundaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Entering into the dreams He wanders through far off regions.

lines.gurmukhi: rMku rwau rwau rMku hoie duK suK ivic pauNdw
lines.transliteration_english: Ranku Raau Raau Ranku Hoi Doukh Soukh Vichi Paoundaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Making the poor a king and the king a poor person He puts them in pain and pleasure.

lines.gurmukhi: qqw sIArw hoie jlu Awvtxu KauNdw
lines.transliteration_english: Tataa Seearaa Hoi Jalu Aavatanu Khaoundaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the form of water He Himself gets hot and cold.

lines.gurmukhi: hrK sog ivic Dwvdw cwvwey cauNdw
lines.transliteration_english: Harakh Sog Vichi Dhaanvadaa Chaavaaay Chaoundaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Amidst sorrows and delights He moves around and responds to the call when called.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK suKu rauNdw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Soukhu Raoundaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh, realising  His nature of premeating through all, attains happiness.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 sB ivc vrqdw inrlyp hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Deserving distinctions

lines.gurmukhi: smsir vrsY sÍwNq bUMd ijau sBnI QweI
lines.transliteration_english: Samasari Varasai Saant Boond Jiu Sabhanee Daaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the drops of rain in the svati nakstr (fifteenth star formation among the) twenty seven star formations known in india) fall equally at all places,

lines.gurmukhi: jl AMdir jlu hoie imlY DrqI bhu BweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Andari Jalu Hoi Milai Dharatee Bahu Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And falling into water they merge in water and on earth they become earth;

lines.gurmukhi: ikrK ibrK rs ks Gxy Plu Pulu suhweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kirakh Birakh Ras Kas Ghanay Phalu Phulu Suhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: At places it transforms into plants and vegetation, sweet and bitter; at some places they are well adorned with myriad flowers and fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: kyly ivic kpUru hoie sIqlu suKdweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaylay Vichi Kapooru Hoi Seetalu Soukhudaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Falling on the banana leaves they transform into cooling camphor.

lines.gurmukhi: moqI hovY isp muih bhu mol mulweI
lines.transliteration_english: Motee Hovai Sip Muhi Bahu Mol Mulaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The same when they fall into a sea-shell become pearls.

lines.gurmukhi: ibsIAr dy muih kwlkUt icqvY buirAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Biseear Day Muhi Kaalakoot Chitavay Buriaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gone into the mouth of a snake they turn into deadly poison and always think evil.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw siqsMig suBweI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Satisangi Soubhaaee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord prevades all places and sits in state in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 sMgq dw Asr-nwn`qÍ

Shabad OS B.translation: Effect of the company  -

lines.gurmukhi: soeI qwNbw rMg sMig ijau kYhw hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Soee Taanbaa Rang Sangi Jiu Kaihaan Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mixing with tin, the copper transforms into bronze.

lines.gurmukhi: soeI qwNbw ijsq imil ipql AvloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Soee Taanbaa Jisat Mili Pital Avaloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The same copper mixed with zinc appears in the form of brass.

lines.gurmukhi: soeI sIsy sMgqI BMgwr BloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Soee Seesay Sangatee Bhangaar Bhuloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Copper mixed with lead changes pewter, a brittle metal called bharath in the Punjab.

lines.gurmukhi: qwNbw pwris prisAw hoie kMcn soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Taanbaa Paarasi Parasiaa Hoi Kanchan Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the touch of the philosopher’s stone, the same copper becomes gold.

lines.gurmukhi: soeI qwNbw Bsm hoie AauKD kir BoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Soee Taanbaa Bhasam Hoi Aoukhadh Kari Bhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When transformed into ashes copper becomes a medicine.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw sMgiq gux goeI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Sangati Goun Goee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, though the Lord is omnipresent, yet the effects of the company of man are different over men. Knowing this much, the Lord is eulogised in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 jl dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of water

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI kwly rMg ivc ijau kwlw idsY
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Kaalay Rangi Vichi Jiu Kaalaa Disai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As water mixed with black dye looks black

lines.gurmukhi: rqw rqy rMg ivic imil myil silsY
lines.transliteration_english: Rataa Ratay Rangi Vichi Mili Mayli Salisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And mixed with red water becomes red;

lines.gurmukhi: pIlY pIlw hoie imlY ihqu jyhI ivsY
lines.transliteration_english: Peelai Peelaa Hoi Milai Hitu Jayhee Visai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It turns out to be yellow adding yellow dye;

lines.gurmukhi: swvw swvy rMg imil siB rMg sirsY
lines.transliteration_english: Saavaa Saavay Rangi Mili Sabhi Rang Sarisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And with the green becomes pleasure-giving green.

lines.gurmukhi: qqw TMFw hoiekY ihq ijsY iqsY
lines.transliteration_english: Tataa Tdaddhaa Hoi Kai Hit Jisai Tisai.

Shabad OS B.translation: According to the seasons it becomes hot or cold.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK suK ijsY ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Soukhu Jisai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the Lord God operates to the needs(of creatures). The Guru-oriented (gurmukh) who is full of joy understands this mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 hor diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Other examples

lines.gurmukhi: dIvw blY bYsMqrhu cwnx AwnHyry
lines.transliteration_english: Deevaa Balai Baisantarahu Chaananu Anhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fire lits the lamp and light scatters in the darkness.

lines.gurmukhi: dIpk ivchuN msu hoie kMm Awie ilKyry
lines.transliteration_english: Deepak Vichahoun Masu Hoi Kanm Aai Likhayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ink obtained from the lamp is used by the writer.

lines.gurmukhi: kjlu hovY kwmxI sMig Bly Blyry
lines.transliteration_english: Kajalu Hovai Kaamanee Sangi Bhalay Bhalayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: From that lamp women get collyrium.

lines.gurmukhi: msvwxI hir jsu ilKY dPqr Aglyry
lines.transliteration_english: Masavaanee Hari Jasu Likhai Dadhatar Agalayray.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the same ink are written eulogies of the Lord and the clerk writes accounts in his office.

lines.gurmukhi: ibrKoN ibrK aupwieNdw Pl Pul Gnyry ]
lines.transliteration_english: Birakhon Birakh Oupaainda Phal Phul Ghanayray?

Shabad OS B.translation: Therefore by living in the company of good persons one engages himself in good deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK cauPyry ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Chaudhayray ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only gurmukh realises this fact, that the Lord pervades all around.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 Anykqw ivc eykqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Unity in diversity

lines.gurmukhi: ibrKu hovY bIau bIjIAY krdw pwswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Birakhu Hovai Beeu Beejeeai Karadaa Paasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From seed comes up the tree and then it spreads further.

lines.gurmukhi: jV AMdir pyf bwhrw bhu fwl ibsQwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Jarh Andari Payd Baaharaa Bahu Daal Bisadaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Root extends in earth, the stem outside and the branches extend all around.

lines.gurmukhi: pq Pul PlIdw rs rMg svwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Pat Phul Phal Phaleedaa Ras Rang Savaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It becomes full of flowers, fruits, and means of many colours and delightful essences.

lines.gurmukhi: vwsu invwsu aulwsu kir hoie vf prvwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaasu Nivaasu Ulaasu Kari Hoi Vad Paravaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In its flowers and fruits dwell fragrance and joy and now this seed becomes a large family.

lines.gurmukhi: Pl ivic bIau sMjIau hoie Pl PloN hjwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Phal Vichi Beeu Sanjeeu Hoi Phal Phalay Hajaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Again the fruit by producing seeds becomes the source of myriad flowers and fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK insqwrw ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Nisataaraa ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Understanding of this very fact that the Lord alone is among all makes the gurmukh liberated.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 sUq dw diRSRtwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of thread

lines.gurmukhi: hovy sUq kpwh dw kir qwxw vwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hovay Sootu Kapaah Daa Kari Taanaa Vaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From cotton the thread and then its warp and waft is prepared.

lines.gurmukhi: sUqhu kpVu jwxIAY AwKwx vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Sootahu Kaparhu Jaaneeai Aakhaan Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is well known that from that very thread the cloth is made.

lines.gurmukhi: causI qY cauqwr hoie gMgw jlu jwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaousee Tai Chaoutaar Hoi Gangaa Jalu Jaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Made of the four  threads are what are known as chausi, gangajali etc.(in india).

lines.gurmukhi: Kwsw mlml isrIswPu qnsuK min Bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaasaa Malamal Sireesaaphu Tan Soukh Mani Bhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The superior clothes (malmal, sirisaph) made out of it impart comfort and pleasure to the body.

lines.gurmukhi: pwg duptw colxw ptkw prvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Pag Doupataa Cholanaa Patoukaa Paravaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming turban, scarf, waist coat etc that thread from cotton becomes acceptable to one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK rMg mwxw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Rang Maanaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord permeates among all and the gurmukhs enjoy His love.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 sony dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of gold

lines.gurmukhi: suinAwrw suienw GVY ghxy swvwry
lines.transliteration_english: Souniaaraa Suinaa Gharhai Gahanay Saavaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The goldsmith creates beautiful ornaments out of gold.

lines.gurmukhi: ippl vqry vwlIAwN qwnauVy qwry
lines.transliteration_english: Pipal Vataray Vaaleeaa Taanaurhay Taaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among them many are like pipal leaf for adornment of ears and many are made of gold wire.

lines.gurmukhi: vysr niQ vKwxIAY kMT mwlw Dwry
lines.transliteration_english: Vaysari Nadi Vakhaaneeai Kantd Maalaa Dhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: From gold, nose-rings and necklaces are also worked into their shape.

lines.gurmukhi: tIkiq mxIAw moiqsr gjry pwswry
lines.transliteration_english: Teekati Maneeaa Motisar Gajaray Paasaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ornament for the forehead (tikka), jewels studded necklace, pearl garlands are made.

lines.gurmukhi: durw buh`tw gol Cwp kir bhu prkwry
lines.transliteration_english: Dur Bahoutaa Gol Chhaap Kari Bahu Parakaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Variegated wrist chains and round rings are prepared from gold.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK vIcwry ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Veechaaray ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh feels that like gold He is the basis of each and every thing.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 gMny dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of sugarcane

lines.gurmukhi: gMnw kolU pIVIAY rsu dy drhwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Gannaa Koloo Peerheeai Rasu Day Darahaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crushed by the crushing machine sugarcane gives juice instantly.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI kry guVu BylIAwN ko skr vwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Karay Gurhu Bhayleeaan Ko Sakar Vaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Some prepare lumps of jaggery and brown sugar out of it.

lines.gurmukhi: koeI KMf svwrdw mKx mswlw
lines.transliteration_english: Koee Khand Savaaradaa Makhan Masaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Some prepare refined sugar and some adding in it sweet drops make special jaggery.

lines.gurmukhi: hovY imsrI klIkMd imiTAweI Fwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Hovai Misaree Kaleekand Mitdiaaee Ddhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is moulded into lump sugar and variegated sweets.

lines.gurmukhi: KwvY rwjw rMku kir rs Bog suKwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaavai Raajaa Ranku Kari Ras Bhog Soukhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The poor and the wealthy both eat it with pleasure.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK suKwlw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Soukhaalaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: God (similar to sugarcane juice) permeates through all; for gurmukhs He is the essence of all the pleasures.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 gwN dy du`D dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of cow-milk

lines.gurmukhi: gweIN rMg ibrMg bhu duDu aujlu vrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gaaee Rang Birang Bahu Dudhu Ujalu Varanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cows are of different hues but the milk of all is white.

lines.gurmukhi: duDhu dhI jmweIAY kir inhclu Drxw
lines.transliteration_english: Dudhahu Dahee Jamaaeeai Kari Nihachalu Dharanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For making curd Some rennet is added into it and then it is placed undistributed.

lines.gurmukhi: dhI ivloie AloeIAY Cwih mKx qrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Dahee Viloi Aloeeai Chhaahi Makhan Taranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By churning curd one finds butter over the butter milk.

lines.gurmukhi: mKxu qwie AautwiekY iGau inrml krxw
lines.transliteration_english: Makhanu Taai Aoutaai Kai Ghiu Niramal Karanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The butter boiled properly is transformed into ghee – clarified butter.

lines.gurmukhi: hom jg neIvyd kir sB kwrj srxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hom Jag Naeevayd Kari Sabh Kaaraj Saranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then that ghee is used as burnt offering and him yajn(rituals) and other oblation are performed.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK hoie jrxw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Hoi Jaranaa ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh knows that the Lord is all pervading but to reach Him one has to have  spiritual quest as well as the sense of contentment.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 sUrj dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of sun

lines.gurmukhi: pl GVIAw mUriq phr iQq vwr gxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pal Gharheeaa Moorati Pahari Dit Vaar Ganaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: From moments, the gharis (a unit of time equal to 22).

lines.gurmukhi: duie pK bwrh mwh kir sMjog bxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Pakh Baarah Maah Kari Sanjog Banaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: (5 minutes), muhurat (auspicious time), the quarters of day and night (pahar – three hourstime) dates and days have been counted. Then joining two fortnights (dark- light) and twelve months have been made.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruqI vrqweIAw bhu cilq bxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routee Varataaeeaan Bahu Chalit Banaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many inspiring visuals have been created through the six seasons.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj ieku vrqdw loku vyd Alwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraju Iku Varatadaa Loku Vayd Alaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: But as say the knowledgeable persons the sun remains the same among these all.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrn iCA drsnw bhu pMQ clwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Chhia Darasanaan Bahu Padi Chalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similiarly, four varans, six philosophies and many sects have been promulgated,

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK smJwey ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Samajhaaay ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: But the gurmukh understands all (and hence there should be no in-fightings).

lines.gurmukhi: 15 auho Bwv bYsMqr dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Same idea-example of fire

lines.gurmukhi: ieku pwxI iek Driq hY bhu ibrK aupwey
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Paanee Ik Dharati Hai Bahu Birakh Oupaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The water is one and the earth is also one but the flora is of variegated qualities.

lines.gurmukhi: APl sPl prkwr bhu Pl Pul suhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Aphal Saphal Parakaar Bahu Phal Phul Suhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many are devoid of fruits and many are adorned with flowers and fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: bhu rs rMg suvwsnw prikriq suBwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bahu Ras Rang Suvaasanaa Parakirati Soubhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They have diverse kinds of fragrance  and by their many kinds of extracts they enhance the grandeur of Nature.

lines.gurmukhi: bYsMqru ieku vrn hoie sB qrvr Cwey
lines.transliteration_english: Baisantaru Iku Varan Hoi Sabh Taravar Chhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The same fire is there in all trees.

lines.gurmukhi: gupqhuN prgt hoie kY BsmMq krwey
lines.transliteration_english: Goupatahu Paragat Hoi Kai Bhasamant Karaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: That unmanifest fire becoming manifest reduces all to ashes.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK suK pwey ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Soukh Paaay ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, that (unmanifest) Lord resides in all and this very fact makes Gurmukhs full of  delight.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 ibrd pwln

Shabad OS B.translation: Living up to one's natural repute

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vws vxwspiq sB cMdn hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaas Vanaasapati Sabh Chandan Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The whole vegetation planted near sandal tree becomes fragrant like sandal.

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu iek Dwqu hoie sMig pwris FovY
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Ik Dhaatu Hoi Sangi Paarasi Ddhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being in touch with the philosophers’s stone and the alloy of light metals transforms into one metal (gold).

lines.gurmukhi: ndIAw nwly vwhVY imil gMg gMgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Nadeeaa Naalay Vaaharhay Mili Gang Gangovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rivers, streams and brooks after joining the Ganges are known by the name of Ganges.

lines.gurmukhi: piqq auDwrxu swDu sMg pwpwN mlu DovY
lines.transliteration_english: Patit Udhaaranu Saadhasangu Paapaan Malu Dhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The redeemer of the fallen ones is the holy congregation wherein the dirt of sins is cleansed.

lines.gurmukhi: nrk invwr AsMK hoie lK piqq sMgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Narak Nivaar Asankh Hoi Lakh Patit Sangovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of apostates and hells have obtained redemption through and in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK AlovY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Alovai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh beholds and understands that God pervades one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 pRym

Shabad OS B.translation: Love

lines.gurmukhi: dIpk hyqu pqMg dw jl mIn qrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Deepak Haytu Patang Daa Jal Meen Tarandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Moth loves burning lamp and fish goes on swimming in water for love of It.

lines.gurmukhi: imrgu nwd ivsmwdu hY Bvr kvil vsMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Miragu Naad Visamaadu Hai Bhavar Kavali Vasandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For deer the musical sound is the source of delight, and the black bee being in love for lotus gets enveloped in it.

lines.gurmukhi: cMd ckor prIiq hY dyiK iDAwnu DrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Chand Chakor Pareeti Hai Daykhi Dhiaanu Dharandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The redlegged patridge (chakor) loves the moon and concentrates upon it.

lines.gurmukhi: ckvI sUrj hyqu hY sMjogu bxMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Chakavee Sooraj Haytu Hai Sanjogu Banandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Female ruddy sheldrake (chakavi) loves the sun and only on sunrise it meets and mates with its patner.

lines.gurmukhi: nwir Bqwr ipAwru hY mwN puqu imlMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Bhataar Piaaru Hai Maan Poutu Miladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Woman loves her husband and it is love that the mother brings forth the son.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK prcMdw ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Parachandaa ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Beholding Him operative in all, the gurmukh feels contented.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 AMgwN dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Examples of organs-eyes etc.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI AMdir dyKdw sB coj ivfwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Andari Daykhadaa Sabh Choj Vidaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the eyes (of the world) He beholds all the wondrous feats.

lines.gurmukhi: kMnI suxdw suriq kir AwKwix vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Kannee Sounadaa Surati Kari Aakhaani Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: With full consciousness He listens to the stories narrated.

lines.gurmukhi: jIBY AMdir boldw bhu swd luBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Jeebhai Andari Boladaa Bahu Saad Loubhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through tongue, He speaks and relishes all the tastes.

lines.gurmukhi: hQI ikriq kmwvdw pig clY sujwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hatheen Kirati Kamaanvadaa Pagi Chalai Sujaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He works with hands and He, the  Omniscient One, walks on feet.

lines.gurmukhi: dyhI AMdir iek mnu ieMdRI prvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Dayhee Andari Iku Manu Indree Paravaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In body, He is the mind whose orders are obeyed by all the organs.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK suKu mwxw ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Soukhu Maanaa ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Understanding (the fact) that He permeates through all, gurmukhs feel delighted.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 siRStI qy siRSty dw pRbMD

Shabad OS B.translation: The relation between the creation and the creator

lines.gurmukhi: pvx gurU guru sbdu hY rwg nwd vIcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Pavan Guroo Guru Sabadu Hai Raag Naad Veechaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The basis of the world is air (the mixture of gases) and Sabad (Word) is the Guru of all knowledge from which flow further all thoughts, music and attendant sounds.

lines.gurmukhi: mwq ipqw jlu Driq hY auqpq sMswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Maat Pitaa Jalu Dharati Hai Outapati Sansaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mother and father are the creative forces in the form of earth and water.

lines.gurmukhi: dweI dwieAw rwiq idhu vrqy vrqwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Daaee Daaiaa Raati Dihu Varatay Varataaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Night and day are the nurses who nurse for the creatures and this way the whole system goes on operating.

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI dw Kylu mylu prikriq pswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee Daa Khaylu Maylu Parakirati Pasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the combination of Siva (the consciousness) and Sakti (the inert nature) this whole world comes into being.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm Git cMdR Akwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabraham Pooran Brahamu Ghati Chandu Akaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That transcendental perfect Lord is permeating through all as the same moon in the sky is visualised in all the pitchers of water.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK inrDwrw ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Niradhaaraa ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: That Lord beyond all the sustenances is the sustenance for the gurmukhs and He alone operates through all.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 Awp hI Awp

Shabad OS B.translation: He and He alone is

lines.gurmukhi: PulwN AMdir vwsu hY hoie Bvru luBwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Phulaan Andari Vaasu Hai Hoi Bhavaru Loubhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Lord is the fragrance in flowers and becoming black bee He is attracted towards flowers.

lines.gurmukhi: AMbwN AMdir rs Dry koiel rs mwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Anbaan Andari Ras Dharay Koil Rasu Maanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sap in the mangoes is He and becoming nightingale He enjoys the same.

lines.gurmukhi: mor bbIhw hoiekY Gx vrs is\\\\wxw
lines.transliteration_english: Mor Babeehaa Hoi Kai Ghan Varas Sivaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming peacock and the rain bird (papthd) only He identifies the delight in raining of the clouds.

lines.gurmukhi: KIr nIr sMjog hoie klIkMd vKwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Kheer Neer Sanjog Hoi Kaleekand Vakhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He transforms Himself into variegated sweets by becoming milk and water.

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwru Akwru kir hoie ipMf prwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaaru Aakaaru Kari Hoi Pind Paraanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The same Formless Lord assuming different forms is residing in all the bodies.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpy Awip vrqdw gurmuiK prvwxw ]20]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapay Aapi Varatadaa Guramoukhi Paravaanaa ?20?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: He is omnipresent in all substances and activities and gurmukhs bow before all such stages.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal enegy, realised through The grace of divine preceptor.

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq AlK AByv Agm Apwr AnMq gur
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Alakh Abhayva , Agam Apaar Anant Gur ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Eternal, imperceptible, fearless, beyond reach, illimitable, infinite and destroyer of the darkness of ignorance

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur nwnk dyv pwrbHm pUrn bHm ]1]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Naanak Dayva , Paarabraham Pooran Braham ?1?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Waheguru (Lord) who is transcendental and immanent in the form of Guru Nanak Dev.

lines.gurmukhi: Agm Apwr AnMq gur Aibgq AlK AByv
lines.transliteration_english: Agam Apaar Anant Gur , Abigat Alakh Abhayv ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The embodiment of formless God, who is imperishable, beyond description, inaccessible, illimitable, infinite and destroyer of darkness of ignorance.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm siqgur nwnk dyv ]2]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabraham Pooran Brahama , Satigur Naanak Dayv ?2?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Satgur (True Guru) Nanak Dev is the immanent form of God.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur nwnk dyv dyv dyvI sB iDAwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Naanak Dayva , Dayv Dayvee Sabh Dhiaavahi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All gods and goddesses contemplate on the True Guru, Guru Nanak Dev.

lines.gurmukhi: nwd bwd ibsmwd rwg rwgin gun gwvih
lines.transliteration_english: Naad Baad Bisamaada , Raag Raagani Goun Gaavahi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: They along with minstrels of heaven sing his praises to the accompaniment of musical instruments producing ecstatic music.

lines.gurmukhi: suMn smwiD AgwiD swD sMgiq sprMpr
lines.transliteration_english: Sounn Samaadhi Agaadhi , Saadh Sangati Saparanpar ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Saints and holy men in his company (Guru Nanak) go in deep meditation and state of nothingness,

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq AlK AByv Agm Agimiq AprMpr ]3]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Alakh Abhayva , Agam Agamiti Aparanpar ?3?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: And get absorbed in the eternal, imperceptible, infinite, fearless, and inaccessible Lord (Satguru). (2)
